Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Ariston The staff is a delight. We had a great home base to see Florence and Tuscany. The Hotel became our home away from home and the staff became our family. This affordable hotel is clean and is close to the grocery store, Post Office and several restaurants. Our stay was fabulous and the staff went out of their way to help and make it happen. Our stay was all about good service. The bottom line is that we recommend the hotel for those on a reasonable budget and would love to return once again for another wonderful stay.Robert  Harriet, Los Angeles
Reviews.Author: HoldingHands

Reviews.Content: good deal, great location i've passed through florence many times (used to live there, still have friends, though alas w/o guest space) so I know how easy it is to get royally ripped off in this town. the ariston is modest but really quite a good deal. clean, reasonably priced, and a very helpful, friendly staff--heard the woman at the desk speaking excellent english. the best thing about it, though, is the very central location: not sure what other reviewers are talking about when they say it's far away from the main sights. santa croce is five minutes' walk, the duomo, the uffizi, and ponte vecchio ten minutes, at least for this former new yorker, and there are plenty of nice little places to eat in the santa croce / sant'ambrogio neighbourhood if you know how to avoid the tourist traps.
Reviews.Author: govab

Reviews.Content: MAKE THE BEST OF IT ... we did and the Hotel Ariston played a major advantage to       Via Fiesolana, the passage way to excitement and quiet relaxation
Reviews.Author: sketchbox

Reviews.Content: Hotel Ariston was a safe haven! My class stayed at the Hotel for the CSU Summer Arts Program and the staff went out of their way to provide us with excellent service. The staff helped us with our luggage up the several flights of stairs and was always available 24 hours a day to help with any problems or emergencies. The night staff made sure the hotel served as a safe haven for our group by keeping undesirable people away from their guest and advising about local customs that are foriegn to us Americans. I also enjoyed the cozy accommodations for breakfast and they make the best cappacino in Italy! I would definately recommend the hotel for any person coming to Firenze to check out the prices are resonable and the staff is friendly.
Reviews.Author: PalmdaleAngel

Reviews.Content: Stay away from Ariston Hotel       Small TV (who watches TV in Florence anyway)
Reviews.Author: anmegk

Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price I was quite happy here considering my budget. It was a good location with walking distance to sites and markets, and the woman that greeted us was outstanding. Out of her way friendly to assist us with where to go or with any questions we had. I thought the breakfast was average, but definately eatable, with cake, soft cheese and biscuits, and toast. On the down side there was no lift with all rooms up stairs, and our room had a dodgy bathroom handle, where we could have trouble getting out of the bathroom. Water was also sometimes not hot but just warmish. Overall not too bad a stay for the price and location.
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirl222

Reviews.Content: Not the best Location In case you are a budget traveller with little or no knowledge of Italian, then hotel Ariston might not be the ideal location for you as it is at quite a distance from the main attractions of Florence. We were dependant on the Florence buses to commute within florence and due to the irregularity and low frequency of these buses, it did prove to be quite inconvenient. Also there are no decent restaurants near or in the hotel, The food served in the restaurant adjacent to the hotel was frankly speaking quite pathetic !!The hotel in itself is quite decent barring the ultra tiny elevator. The receptionist was extremely helpful and he even went out of the way to help us out with rail as well bus information. The room we had was neat and clean and the bathroom too was quite spacious.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for In this case basic accommodation, clean but not a place to linger. Breakfast was missable, bread and a warm drink, corn flakes and cake taken in a very small room too small to accommodate more than about 10 guests at one time. There was a hint of drain small in reception. On the plus side cheap and central. Would we stay there again? NO.
Reviews.Author: Crinabottom

Reviews.Content: Give it a miss - not worth it       The broken chair
Reviews.Author: Colle

Reviews.Content: clean, good location, bathroom Small! We spent 4 nights here. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. They made reservations for us for the Acadamie, but curiously did not know where we could get gelato! (We did, however, find it ourselves.) Location was great, a close walk to all the sights. Room spacious and clean. Our only complaint was that the bathroom flooded every time we took a shower, and there was so little space between the wall and commode that we had to sit sideways! Anyway, we had lots of hot water, kept our clothes and towels off the floor and had a wonderful stay. For the price, I would recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: detroitpam

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, One Bad Clerk The rooms are large for Italy, the bathroom is normal italy (open shower). The breakfast was continental but not bad at all. Close enough to all the attractions (il duomo, uffizi, the arno) and far enough away that you don't get the city noise. We had three different desk clerks, one of them was extremly rude, to the point that we thought of leaving, but the other two were so helpful and courteous that we stayed. For the money, your really can't beat it, if you can deal with the rude desklady.
